name: Biomedical Toxicology
description: This course explores several contemporary topics in biomedical toxicology with emphasis on how chemicals affect human health. Lectures cover principles of toxicology, the mechanisms of toxicity of a wide variety of toxic agents and the associated toxicities, methodologies used to examine chemical toxicities, risk assessment, and the applications of toxicology.
prerequisites: (PCL201H1, PCL302H1, PCL362H1) or Permission of the Course Coordinator

instructors: J McPherson C Woodland R Tyndale P Lala
